H0.text: Neurotransmitters are the objects released at a synapse to carry a nerve impulse from one neuron to the next.

H1.text: Viruses are the objects released at a synapse to carry a nerve impulse from one neuron to the next.

H2.text: Receptors are the objects released at a synapse to carry a nerve impulse from one neuron to the next.

H3.text: Microorganisms are the objects released at a synapse to carry a nerve impulse from one neuron to the next.

A4.text: Neurotransmitters are tiny signal molecules stored in membrane-enclosed synaptic vesicles and released via exocytosis.

A5.text: Chemical synapses communicate through neurotransmitters released from the presynaptic neuron into the synaptic cleft.
